messages.message:
At a glance, `deploy-saas-aws-preprod` is failing > 90% of the time. :sob:

Picked `release-24-07` sandbox deployment (https://jenkins.instabase.com/job/build-services/29238/console) as a spot-check
Services failing to build are:
• `post-install-action-retention-rules`
• `post-install-action-test-runner`
• `search-tservice`
Check of `aihub-sandbox` deployment (https://jenkins.instabase.com/job/build-services/29237/console), failing services:
• `connector-sharepoint`
• `generic-connectors`
Fascinating lack of overlap in services, but some overlap in packages failing:
• `mypy-0.812-cp39-cp39-manylinux2010_x86_64.whl`
    ◦ Affects: `post-install-action-retention-rules` `post-install-action-test-runner` `search-tservice` `connector-sharepoint`
    ◦ Expect: `33f159443db0829d16f0a8d83d94df3109bb6dd801975fe86bacb9bf71628e97`
    ◦ Got: `4dc0ce006c6ed34c450a9dc7b665ad63b657f427eec4f0f2f580e9ffa57b4a48`
• `pydantic_core-2.27.2-cp310-cp310-manylinux_2_17_x86_64.manylinux2014_x86_64.whl`
    ◦ Affects: `generic-connectors`
    ◦ Expect: `47956ae78b6422cbd46f772f1746799cbb862de838fd8d1fbd34a82e05b0983a`
    ◦ Got: `5b29ad3774d5d15883305e5202da6483b0854831455509b4ebbeaa8aa6d46f70`
~My money's on "pypi is busted" but I haven't chased that hunch yet lol~

Seems not pypi, but I didn't dig deep there.

Just some more details I gathered from the examples above:
1. They all ran on discrete builder nodes
2. None of those nodes are around currently (didn't get 'stuck')
3. The build environment for these is containerized, and the `bazel` cache local to the build is *NOT* persisted to the host FS (no bind mounts of `/home/ubuntu/.cache/bazel`)
4. The network flakiness hypothesis from @sean.donohoe makes sense in light of previous experiences, but I don't know why it's suddenly so consistent. :thinking_face:

Rebuild (https://jenkins.instabase.com/job/service-builder/job/build-service/810658/console) of `generic-connectors` on `aihub-uat` worked fine, which tracks with 'flaky network'

I don't rightly know what's the right troubleshooting / debugging path, TBH.

I know lots of ways to dive into low level breakages, but this one is so hard to repro consistently that it's much trickier. :thonk:
Having this issue on my PR (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/68707/) as well here. Is there a way we can contribute to debugging this issue @Cody Boggs

Looks like the last attempt was ~12 hours ago, rebuilding now to see if it passes just to get you unblocked.

I don't think it's as consistent in failing right now, but will monitor.
I am very happy seeing this!
Do you know if it's possible to restart jobs automatically if we can detect that the failures are transient?
